sections.name: Graylok Ambusher
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Uncommon
traits.text: Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2.

traits.name: Chaotic
traits.text: Chaotic effects often manipulate energy from chaos-aligned Outer Planes and are anathema to lawful divine servants or divine servants of lawful deities. A creature with this trait is chaotic in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Cold
traits.text: Effects with this trait deal cold damage. Creatures with this trait have a connection to magical cold.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

automatic_abilities.name: Deny Advantage
automatic_abilities.text: A Graylok ambusher isn't flat-footed to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of 8th level or lower or creatures of 8th level or lower using sneak attack. However, such creatures can still help other creatures flank.

automatic_abilities.name: Opportune Backstab
automatic_abilities.trigger: A creature within melee reach is hit by a melee attack from one of the Graylok ambusher's allies
automatic_abilities.effect: The Graylok ambusher attempts a Strike against the triggering creature.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Sweep
traits.text: This weapon makes wide sweeping or spinning attacks, making it easier to attack multiple enemies. When you attack with this weapon, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll if you already attempted to attack a different target this turn using this weapon.

traits.name: Thrown
traits.text: You can throw this weapon as a ranged attack, and it is a ranged weapon when thrown. A thrown weapon adds your Strength modifier to damage just like a melee weapon does. When this trait appears on a melee weapon, it also includes the range increment. Ranged weapons with this trait use the range increment specified in the weapon’s Range entry.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

ability.name: Brutal Beating
ability.text: When the Graylok ambusher scores a critical hit with a melee Strike, the target is frightened 1.

ability.name: Dread Striker
ability.text: Any creature that has the frightened condition is flat-footed against the Graylok ambusher's attacks.

ability.name: Ice Stride
ability.text: A frost giant isn't impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.

ability.name: Light Step
ability.text: When the Graylok ambusher Strides or Steps, they ignore difficult terrain.

ability.name: Sneak Attack
ability.text: The Graylok ambusher deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.
